intro: Pisum arvense var. leptolobum, commonly known as the slender vetch, is a perennial legume native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features trifoliate leaves with slender, oblong leaflets and produces small, yellow flowers that develop into elongated, pod-like fruits. The plant is characterized by its creeping growth habit and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. It has small, yellowish-white flowers and is known for its ability to fix nitrogen, making it valuable in soil enrichment. Its botanical features make it a common weed in agricultural settings.
